speaker: Roz
text: We have Tom on the phone from Woodenville.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_presses button_] Hello, Tom.  I'm listening.

speaker: Tom
text: [_v.o.; anxious, speaking rapidly_] Thank God, I thought I'd never get through.  Dr. Crane, I'm-I have a problem, and I don't know what to do.  I'm supposed to get married soon, but I'm having second thoughts.  Do you think it's just cold feet, or-or what?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Tom, just calm down, let's work through this thing together, you and I.  Are you in love with this girl?

speaker: Tom
text: Of course - yes - I, I think.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now remember, Tom, this is the person with whom you'll be spending the rest of your life.  That is a long time.

speaker: Tom
text: It is, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  In fact, getting married is probably the biggest decision you will ever make in your life.  It requires time, temperance, and thought.

speaker: Frasier
text: Tom, what's that music?

speaker: Tom
text: Sorry, Dr. Crane, no time to talk, I have to tell Monica the bad news.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, wait, wait, Tom, no!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.  Well, if anyone out there happens to know Monica, just tell her to call in on Monday and I'll move her right to the head of the line.  Um, meanwhile, this is Dr. Frasier Crane, saying good day, and good mental health.

speaker: Kenny
text: Please, Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: [_half-laughing_] No way!

speaker: Kenny
text: Come on!  I wouldn't be asking you if it wasn't an emergency!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_coming in_] Is everything OK?

speaker: Kenny
text: [_quickly_] Yeah, fine, good, everything's good. [_sighs_] I'm supposed to stop on the way home and pick up some new... underthings for my wife.

speaker: Frasier
text: So?

speaker: Kenny
text: So?  Every time I'm in one of those places I start thinking about... you know... man-and-wife stuff.  I turn all red, I start to sweat, I hyperventilate.  Try getting somebody to wait on you when you look like that.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, sorry, Kenny, but I am not going to Victoria's Secret for you.

speaker: Kenny
text: Victoria's Secret?  Whoa, whoa, Rockefeller, I'm talking Kmart!

speaker: Roz
text: No.

speaker: Kenny
text: Before you say no, let me remind you that employee evaluation season's-

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny!  Roz Doyle is no gofer, she is a producer.  And if she should earn a promotion - which she richly deserves - it will be based on her merits as a producer!

speaker: Kenny
text: Fine.  I'll go myself.  Why do they have those mannequins so damn sexy?

speaker: Joe
text: Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Joe
text: Your cake's ready.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, splendid!  Well, let's just have a look here. [_opens the box; reading_] "Congrats"?  It's supposed to say, "Congratulations, Dad."

speaker: Joe
text: There wasn't room.

speaker: Frasier
text: People have written the Declaration of Independence on a grain of rice!

speaker: Joe
text: Not with frosting.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, my father's starting a new job this evening.  This cake is meant to show him how proud we are, how much we care, and that we believe in him, all right?  It has to be special.

speaker: Joe
text: If it was so special, how come you ordered the smallest one?

speaker: Frasier
text: We're also having ice cream, if you must know!

speaker: Joe
text: [_takes it back_] Fine, you can pick it up in half an hour.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. [_Joe leaves_] Oh, wait!  I haven't got half an hour to- [_but he's gone; sweetly_] Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: [_unsurprised_] You want me to pick up the cake?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, bless you.  Oh, and listen, could you pick up some ice cream on your way over, too?

speaker: Roz
text: Sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hurrying out_] That's a love, bye! **BEWARE LOLLYGAGGING MESSENGERS** _Scene Two(a) - Apartment Daphne opens the door to Niles._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, honey. [_they hug and kiss_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_as he hangs up his coat_] I have a surprise for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: I have a surprise for you, too. _Simultaneously they produce ticket envelopes.  Laughing, they exchange and open them._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_thrilled_] Oh my God, tickets to the Billy Joel concert!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes... tickets to the Mongolian Music Festival? [_looks up, no less thrilled_] That's four solid hours of throat singing!

speaker: Daphne
text: How in the world did you get these?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh well, I know a guy who knows a guy who has a friend that was able to pull a few strings.  How did you get these?

speaker: Daphne
text: I called the box office.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_hugs him again_] Oh, thank you so much!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, thank you.

speaker: Both
text: Oh, when is it? [_laughs, then_] Tonight.

speaker: Both
text: Oh...

speaker: Daphne
text: Wow...

speaker: Niles
text: So, em, which one shall we attend?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, it's always been a dream of mine to see Billy Joel live.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes... but has it been a lifelong dream, like my dream of seeing Mongolian throat-singers?  [__N.B. Try to say this once without laughing, then try it three times fast.  It's impossible.__]

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, but didn't we just do a "you" thing last week when we went to the opera?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but you're forgetting that the next night, we rented "Mrs. Doubtfire," which was definitely a "you" movie.

speaker: Daphne
text: Except they didn't have it, so we rented "Tampopo," which I believe we found in the "you" section.  And we listened to NPR on the way there _and_ on the way back, don't think I didn't notice that.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, perhaps I have been a bit piggish lately.  We'll see Billy Joel! [_she starts to hug him_] But-but-but, I am not going in any mosh pit.

speaker: Daphne
text: OK! [_hugs him_] _Martin comes out, dressed in a security guard's uniform and carrying a handful of neckties._

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, look at you, Mr. Security Guard.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, beware, criminals - Martin Crane is back on the streets.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  Actually, Martin Crane is sitting on his butt in a fancy lobby, staring at a bunch of monitors. [_holds out ties_] Daph, are any of these navy blue?

speaker: Niles
text: Here, I can help you with that, Dad.  Daphne, would you- would you get us some coffee?

speaker: Daphne
text: Sure.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, uh, are you, uh - you ready for all this, you know? Going back to work?

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, we talked about this, it's only three nights a week.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I know, I know, but, uh... _They sit down, Martin in his Armchair and Niles on the coffee table. Throughout the following conversation, Niles becomes a living revue of tics, fidgets, and shuffles._

speaker: Niles
text: You're going through your old routine.  Putting on the badge, going back on duty, you're even going to be working with some of your old friends from the force.  Just be aware, it, uh, it might bring up buried memories.

speaker: Martin
text: Like what?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, the last time you worked, some crazy person pointed a, uh, a, uh... [_makes a gun with his hand_] you know, at you, and you were almost, uh... [_starts shifting in his seat_] you ended up in the, uh, the, uh... [_starts flicking his ear with his finger_] Well, you could've, uh, could've, uh, you could have actually... well, I just - probably you're going to have a lot of issues. [_stops fidgeting_]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, thanks for being concerned, Niles, but, trust me, I don't have any buried memories.  I remember every detail of that day. _As Martin speaks, the scene DISSOLVES to a flashback sequence:  An unmarked car pulls into the parking lot outside a convenience store._

speaker: Martin
text: [_v.o._] Frank and I were near the end of our shift.  He wanted to get a drink.  I said no, but he was thirsty.  So we go to a convenience store.  There was a robbery in progress.  I got shot. _Martin, wearing plainclothes, gets out of the car and walks into the store.  CUT BACK to the Present:_

speaker: Martin
text: It was a hell of a thing.

speaker: Niles
text: Sure was.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I got to get going.  A few of the guys are taking me out for dinner before my first shift.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, uh, Dad, you can't leave yet.  We're having a little send- off party.  Frasier's on his way with the cake.

speaker: Daphne
text: Here's your coffee, Mr. Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks, Daph.

speaker: Waitress
text: [_v.o._] Here's your coffee, Marty. _The scene DISSOLVES to another flashback:  Scene Three - Diner Earlier that fatal day, Martin and his partner Frank are sat eating lunch.  A goldfish in a plastic bag of water sits between them. Martin has just gotten his coffee._

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks, doll.

speaker: Frank
text: [_lifting the bag_] You going to carry that fish around all day?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, he has a name. [_takes the bag_] That's Eddie.

speaker: Frank
text: Why don't you get yourself a real pet?  You know, like a- like a dog?

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, I'm not really a dog person.  I just wanted someone in the family I could get along with.  Did I tell you Frasier's not coming home for Thanksgiving?

speaker: Frank
text: [_many, many times_] Yeah, you did.

speaker: Martin
text: And have I told you about my weekly Sunday brunch with Niles and Maris?

speaker: Frank
text: Yeah, you have.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, I'd rather be at church.  I'd get more to eat. [__N.B. David Hyde Pierce had to wear a hairpiece to look like the full-headed Niles of earlier seasons.__]

speaker: Frank
text: Hey, speaking of Niles, isn't that him? _Martin turns around.  Niles beckons to him.  Martin motions Niles in, but Niles shakes his head, obviously looking down his nose at the place. Martin motions him in again.  Niles wrinkles his nose and comes in._

speaker: Frank
text: Hey, Niles. [_motions to the seat_] Take a load off.

speaker: Martin
text: What's up?

speaker: Niles
text: [_as he wipes the chair_] You know very well what's up. Maris just called me.  You booted her car. [_throws the hankie on the table_]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, I remember having a car booted earlier.  It was parked kind of close to a hydrant.  Was that hers?

speaker: Niles
text: The license plate says "Maris"!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's a very common name, isn't it, Frank?

speaker: Frank
text: My mother's name is Maris.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, Maris is very upset, and so am I.  I can't believe you booted her.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I wouldn't be upset if _you_ booted her. _Frank laughs and slaps Martin's hand under the table.  Niles stands up in a huff._

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, she's loaded.  She'll probably just ditch it and go buy another one.

speaker: Niles
text: That's not the point!  I think you owe her an apology. [_to Frank_] Good day... [_disdainfully_] Frank.

speaker: Frank
text: You booted a car just to irritate your kid?  Now that's a lot of trouble.

speaker: Martin
text: No, the real trouble was getting four guys to lift it and move it closer to the hydrant. [_they laugh_] _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene Two(b) - Apartment A flashbulb goes off, snapping Martin out of his reverie.  Niles has just taken his picture.  Daphne brings his lunchbox and thermos._

speaker: Daphne
text: Here you are.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks.

speaker: Daphne
text: Honey, get a picture of your father with his thermos.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, enough with the pictures!  People didn't make this much fuss when I shipped off to Korea! _But he raises the thermos and smiles gamely for the camera. Frasier comes in the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Dad!  Very snappy.

speaker: Martin
text: Uh-huh.  Where's the cake?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz'll be bringing it by in a minute.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frasier, if you're interested, I have two tickets to tonight's throat singing concert.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't toy with me, Niles!

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell is throat singing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, it's an extraordinary technique where a single vocalist can actually produce two distinct tones simultaneously, allowing him to harmonize with himself!

speaker: Martin
text: Kind of like the Everly Brothers. _Frasier and Niles trade another one of their "Did he actually just SAY that?" looks._

speaker: Frasier
text: If they shared a throat and came from Mongolia, yes. [_trades another look_] Niles, why aren't you going?

speaker: Daphne
text: He's taking me to see Billy Joel.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_aghast_] Billy Joel?!

speaker: Niles
text: [_putting the best face on it_] He's the "Piano Man."

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, seeing as how you're otherwise occupied, I'll guess I'll try to just wrangle myself a date. [_picks up the phone_]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, wait a minute!  Who's going to walk Eddie?  I told you he has to be walked every night at ten.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, of course, Dad, of course, Dad.  Uh, well, you know, customarily this would fall under the description of, uh... Daphne's job.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_piqued_] Customarily, Dr. Crane, it's not my job.  I do it as a favor for your father.

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you do it as a favor for me?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: [_checks his watch_] You know, Frasier, you could catch the first two hours of throat singing and still get back in time to walk Eddie.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, you know damn well their throats are just starting to warm up after two hours!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm not missing Billy Joel.

speaker: Martin
text: [_gets up_] Gee, I hate to put you all out like this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I'm sorry.  Don't worry, we'll work this out, I promise.

speaker: Frasier
text: Say, what about that nice Mrs. Curdsman who lives right across the hall?

speaker: Daphne
text: She's ninety-four - someone comes to walk _her_ everyday!

speaker: Frasier
text: There's got to be somebody on God's green earth that can walk this dog. _The doorbell rings.  Frasier opens the door to Roz, carrying the cake.  I love this shot: Roz's P.O.V. - Frasier, Niles, and Daphne all looking at her with delighted, transparently self-concerned smiles._

speaker: All
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, cake's here.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes it_] Yes.  You know, Roz, we were just talking about you - say, listen, are you busy this evening?

speaker: Roz
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's terrific news!  Well then, you won't mind coming by and walking Eddie about ten o'clock?

speaker: Roz
text: [_had enough_] Forget it, Frasier.  I am not your assistant, I am a producer.  A producer does not give up her evenings to walk a dog.

speaker: Frasier
text: Would a _senior_ producer walk a dog? [_she doesn't even answer that one_] Well, someone has got to walk this damn dog.

speaker: Martin
text: [_coming out_] All right, that's enough.  You all said you'd be supportive if I went back to work.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, for the first two or three seconds until it gets inconvenient, then all you think about is yourself. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm not in a party mood. _He heads for his room, but stops to pick up the cake and take it with him.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_ **SHE HAS BIG ONES, TOO** _Scene Four - Martin's Room Martin is tying his tie in the mirror.  Someone knocks on his door._

speaker: Martin
text: What do you want?

speaker: Roz
text: [_o.s._] It's me, Roz.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on in.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s._] Are you people insane?  How can paper beat a rock!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm really looking forward to getting out of the house.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I didn't want you to go before I had a chance to give you this. [_gives him a small jewelry box_]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you didn't have to do that! [_opens it_] Oh, a tie pin! Oh, look at the little handcuffs!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, we don't want that tie to escape.

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: So it's a big day, isn't it?

speaker: Martin
text: Mmm-hmm.

speaker: Roz
text: You feeling good?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I feel better than that; I feel useful.  It's been a long time.  You know, when I was a cop, we used to make fun of security guards.  I guess now I'm going to have to make fun of crossing guards.

speaker: Roz
text: Who do crossing guards make fun of?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know.  Uh, kids, I guess.

speaker: Martin
text: Hello?  Oh, hey, Frank.  Yup, got my W-4.  Uh, listen, I want to thank you again, for getting me in, you know.  I know you had to push, what with my hip and all... No, I'm just thanking you again, that's all.  That's not mushy!  Huh?  Oh, that's too bad.  OK, well, maybe next time.  Bye. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Roz
text: What's too bad?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, a bunch of us are going out for dinner, but one guy can't make it.  Evidently he got called to check on a possible perv at the Kmart. _He tastes a finger-full of frosting from the cake, and goes to the mirror again._

speaker: Martin
text: I got to tell you, Roz, hanging out with a bunch of guys again is - well, something I've really missed.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh... [_comes up behind him_] well, I am happy for you, Martin. [_kisses his cheek_]

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks, Roz.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_o.s._] Let's just all leave now and then Roz will have to walk him.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey! _She rushes out.  Martin shakes his head, and closes the door.  As he pins on his name badge, he stares into the mirror..._

speaker: Frank
text: [_v.o._] Hey, Marty, we've got a Code-9 over here on the right. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Five - Police Car Martin is driving with Frank beside him.  Frank is snacking heavily on a bag of chips._

speaker: Martin
text: Are you blind?  She's a Code-7 at best.

speaker: Frank
text: Oh.  Am I mistaken, or is she swerving?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm not pulling her over, Frank.  Last time I did that, you ended up in divorce court.

speaker: Frank
text: Ah...

speaker: Martin
text: Did I tell you Frasier's not coming home for Thanksgiving?

speaker: Frank
text: Yeah, you did.

speaker: Martin
text: Means I'll have to spend it with Maris and Niles.  Last time she didn't even eat anything, she just sucked air through a rice cake.  Boy, he sure picked a winner.

speaker: Frank
text: Marty, you sound like a broken record.  You know, I get it: you can't stand your kids.

speaker: Martin
text: No!  No, no; they can't stand me.

speaker: Frank
text: Well, maybe you've got to be the one that takes the first step.  You know, reach out.  And most importantly, listen. Not just with your ears, but with your heart.

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell are you talking about?

speaker: Frank
text: I'm seeing a court-appointed family therapist.  I have to admit, it's only been a few sessions, but... she is hot!

speaker: Martin
text: You've come a long way.

speaker: Frank
text: I think it's making me a better dad, you know?  I'm getting involved with their school stuff, I talk to them at the end of the day; I make sure I kiss them goodbye before I go to work.

speaker: Martin
text: Hmm... You really do that?

speaker: Frank
text: Yup.  According to Dr. Hottie, you have to make an effort.

speaker: Martin
text: [_thinks, then smiles_] You know what I should do?

speaker: Frank
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: I ought to just call Frasier out of the blue and see how he's doing.  Niles, too.  They'd probably think I was dying or something.

speaker: Frank
text: You should.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  That's what I'm gonna do.  I'll do it tonight when I get home.

speaker: Frank
text: Good for you, Marty. [_looks out the window_] Hey, can we stop? I need to get another Slushie.

speaker: Martin
text: You just got that one!

speaker: Frank
text: I got rinds in it.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, but I'll go in and get it.  You stay here and clean this mess up. _As before, the car pulls into the parking lot.  Martin gets out of the car and walks into the store.  CUT TO:  Scene Six - Martin's Room Martin is strapping on his belt.  Frasier opens the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good news, Dad!  We worked it out.

speaker: Martin
text: You did?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Listen, Dad, I'm sorry.  I hope our little tiff didn't spoil the occasion.  We're all so proud of you, I want you to know that.

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks, son.  So who's walking Eddie?

speaker: Frasier
text: I am.  I figured if I just take him out right now, I still have time to make it to the concert, and he'll be OK until I come back around midnight.

speaker: Martin
text: I told you, he's got to be walked around ten o'clock, that's his routine!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, can't his routine just bend a little?

speaker: Martin
text: Fine, then I hope your Berber carpet is waterproof.

speaker: Niles
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Frasier
text: Apparently, His Nibs will explode if he doesn't go out around ten!

speaker: Niles
text: OK, OK, OK, OK, how's this: I will stay and walk Eddie.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Daphne
text: You just don't want to see Billy Joel.

speaker: Niles
text: That is patently untrue.  I'm just trying to help my father.

speaker: Roz
text: If he isn't going, can I?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that would work perfectly.

speaker: Frasier
text: But since you're free, Niles, I've got this extra ticket for the throat singing concert!

speaker: Niles
text: [_excited_] Oh?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then it's settled!

speaker: Martin
text: Ed-die.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.  All right, OK, OK, we will work this out, Dad.

speaker: Daphne
text: So what happens when your nibs explode? _Martin closes the door on Frasier's answer.  He is now wearing his jacket, and only his hat remains to be put on.  He picks it up..._

speaker: Frank
text: [_v.o._] You should see it, Marty... _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Seven - Hospital Room Martin is lying in a hospital bed.  Frank is standing by him._

speaker: Frank
text: They're using your rookie picture on the news.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, what's all the fuss about?  It's only my hip.  Ten bucks says I'll be back on the job in a couple of weeks.

speaker: Frank
text: I just keep thinking, you know, it should have been me.

speaker: Nurse
text: Can I do anything to make you more comfortable, Mr. Crane?

speaker: Martin
text: No, I'm fine, thanks.

speaker: Frank
text: Seriously, it should have been me. [_they laugh_]

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frank.  Hello, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: How-how are you, uh... how are you feeling?

speaker: Martin
text: I think I'm going to be fine.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, thank God.

speaker: Frank
text: Well, I'd better get going.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, hey, don't go on my account, Frank.

speaker: Frank
text: Nah, you guys got plenty of things to talk about. [_claps Martin on the shoulder_] Listen, I'll never drink another Slushie again.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, then it was worth it.

speaker: Frank
text: All right. [_to Niles_] See you.

speaker: Niles
text: I just got off the phone with Frasier.  He is flying in.

speaker: Martin
text: Good.

speaker: Martin
text: Doc says I'll be out of here in a couple of days.

speaker: Niles
text: Good.  They have, uh, they have a great staff here.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.

speaker: Niles
text: I knew this was going to happen some day.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, it comes with the territory.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll never understand how you can take these risks.

speaker: Martin
text: No, you probably won't.

speaker: Nurse
text: I'm sorry, visiting hours are over.

speaker: Niles
text: Um, thank you. [_beat_] Well... [_gets up and goes to the door_] I'll be back tomorrow.

speaker: Martin
text: OK. _Niles leaves.  CUT TO:  Scene Eight - Apartment Frasier, Roz, Daphne, and Niles, are still arguing.  Behind them, Martin walks out in his complete uniform._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, we're running out of time!  I'll tell you what: I will offer a hundred dollars to anyone who is willing to walk this dog.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll kick in a hundred!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's two hundred dollars! [_towards Roz_] That's an awful lot of money, isn't it, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: [_towards Daphne_] It sure is, Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: All just to walk a little dog!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, mmm-hmm.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_hits Niles_] I can't believe you'd try to buy me off!

speaker: Roz
text: You, too! [_hits Frasier_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ow!  For God's sake... _Unnoticed by anyone, Martin has picked up his lunchbox and is now standing by the door._

speaker: Martin
text: I'm leaving! [_they continue arguing_] SHUT UP!

speaker: Martin
text: You ought to be ashamed, I can't even depend on my own kids.

speaker: Frasier
text: But, Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: You two, come here. [_points to his feet_]

speaker: Frasier
text: We're sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier started it.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm going to work now.  I'll be home late. [_kisses Frasier on the cheek_] Don't wait up. [_kisses Niles on the cheek_] _He goes out the door.  Another doorway shot shows the boys and girls cannot believe what just happened.  END OF ACT TWO_
